⚗️ Hydrogen may also have a significant role to play in future transport systems and heating homes.

🚗 Exhaust fumes from vehicles are a major contributor to air pollution in cities. 
Shifting to electric vehicles increases demand for clean energy. 
The high availability of #nuclear power plants will be an important factor to help recharge electric vehicles ⚛️ https://t.co/cTlWlIvExO

🏙️ Over half the population in world cities endure worsening air pollution. 
Nuclear power plants can also be used for district heating, avoiding pollution from fossil fuels.

💉Sterilization of medical equipment is also an important use of radioisotopes.

The #nuclear by-product cobalt-60 can kill off harmful and deadly bacteria, making it an effective solution to sterilize medical equipment, such as syringes and catheters.

🔬 Biotechnologists analyse specific molecules inside the body using #nuclear materials. These techniques are an essential research component for chronic illnesses like AIDS and Alzheimer’s disease. https://t.co/sVpF9Vsl5a

Over 40 million nuclear medicine procedures are performed each year, and demand for radioisotopes is increasing at up to 5% annually.

https://t.co/RyRZgyYp47

⚛️ Radioisotopes are used for diagnostics & treatment. Diagnostic procedures using radioisotopes are now routine.

Radioisotopes can be produced by #nuclear reactors,
like Australia's OPAL research Reactor: https://t.co/MxXM5dUgxx
